result.execSummary:
The defendant Tommy Lee Ivy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Same conditions as probation except for condition time.
COURT ORDERS the Dosage Probation Program.

miscConds.notes: Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, must provide a DNA specimen for testing and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause. Do not use or possess any illegally controlled substances.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tommy Lee Ivy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tommy Lee Ivy in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel.  COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, must provide a DNA specimen for testing and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 30 months with 3 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 14 months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 16 months.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.  COURT ORDERS the Dosage Probation Program.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) do not use or possess any illegally controlled substances; 3) random screening; 4) obtain GED; 5) pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 6) SERVE 25 DAYS at the House of Correction - straight time.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 3) random screening; 4) obtain GED

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a specimen for DNA testing.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Tommy Lee Ivy in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant's medication is now in order.  Due to the lateness of the hour and because Attorney Taylor cannot return this afternoon, Court adjourns sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tommy Lee Ivy in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Restitution will be addressed at that time.  There is the possibility of incarceration so defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence at that date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tommy Lee Ivy in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/5/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tommy Lee Ivy in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and the court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Defense counsel will go over discovery with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/5/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tommy Lee Ivy in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Ron Dague for Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
NO ADA OR DA FILE IN COURT.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Arraignment scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond that was previously signed to remain. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-31-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tommy Lee Ivy in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3-23-2015 at 1:30pm
